availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James F. Muncey (Powell County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. )

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Tennessee native. Married to Caroline Garrett Muncey. Father of James Muncey, Amanda Muncey, Ann Muncey, Jessee Muncey, Sarah Muncey, and Mary Muncey. Resident of Powell County, Kentucky, in 1856. Fined for unlawful gaming in Powell County in 1858. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1860. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from October 9, 1861 to January 1864. Served in 11th Veteran Reserve Corps (U.S.A.) as a private from January 30, 1864 to August 17, 1865.
